node.title: COVID-19 world latest: Cruise ship warnings, BoJo against new lockdown despite Omicron
node.description: Here's the latest on the pandemic from around the world.
node.content: ["Here's the latest on the pandemic from around the world.", "Italy", "A survey of wastewater showed the Omicron coronavirus variant spreading to a majority of regions of Italy in December, the Government's National Health Institute said on Monday.", "Italy, the first Western country to be hit by the pandemic early last year, has seen new infections rise steeply in recent weeks. Overall, it has registered 137,786 deaths linked to the virus and has reported 6.4 million cases. Italy reported 68,052 new COVID-19 cases on Monday, against 61,046 the day before, the health ministry said, while the daily tally of coronavirus-related deaths rose to 140 from 133.", "Turkey", "Turkey recorded 44,869 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, the highest daily figure since late April, health ministry data showed on Monday. It also recorded 160 deaths.", "UK", "England and Scotland reported 157,758 new cases of COVID-19 on Monday, according to government data, while another 42 people in England died within 28 days of a positive test.", "New measures are not needed now in Britain to fight the Omicron variant, which is \"plainly milder\" than earlier forms of the coronavirus, Prime Minister Boris Johnson said on Monday.", "France", "French lawmakers reported receiving death threats from suspected anti-vaccination protesters, as Parliament starts to debate legislation that would require people to show proof of vaccination to go to a restaurant or cinema or take the train.", "Portugal", "Passengers stuck on a cruise ship moored in Lisbon's port for five days due to a COVID-19 outbreak began disembarking early on Monday, focused on clearing the final hurdle of a negative test before boarding homebound flights.", "India", "India vaccinated more than 3.8 million teens aged between 15 and 18 years on Monday, as the country expanded an inoculation effort to protect its large adolescent population ahead of a looming wave of coronavirus infections.", "The drive has come amid a sharp rise in cases in India, with the federal health ministry on Monday reporting 33,750 new infections and 123 deaths.\u00a0", "Japan", "The fast spreading Omicron variant lurked behind rising coronavirus infections in Tokyo, where new cases rose to 103 on Monday, up from 84 the previous day and the highest since October 8.", "South Korea", "Two people who posthumously tested positive for the highly contagious Omicron variant of the coronavirus appear to be the first such reported deaths in the country, Yonhap news agency reported on Monday.", "Australia", "Australia said the milder impact of the Omicron variant meant the country could push ahead with plans to reopen the economy even as new infections hit a record of more than 37,000 and the number of people hospitalised rose.", "Pakistan", "Pakistan reported more than 700 cases in a single day, its highest tally in two months, as authorities warned of a fifth wave of infections and made preparations to try to contain Omicron.", "Canada", "Canada's Ontario province on Monday announced restrictions to curb the spread of the coronavirus as officials warned of a \"tsunami\" of new COVID-19 cases in the days and weeks ahead due to the Omicron variant.", "Brazil", "Brazilian health agency Anvisa warned passengers against boarding cruise ships operating along the Brazilian coast after outbreaks of COVID-19 affecting crew and customers.", "US", "Top US infectious disease expert Anthony Fauci said there was still a danger of a surge in hospitalisation due to a large number of coronavirus cases even as early data suggests the Omicron COVID-19 variant is less severe.", "US authorities registered at least 346,869 new coronavirus on Saturday, according to a Reuters tally. The US death toll from COVID-19 rose by at least 377 to 828,562.", "Thousands of US schools, including in some major cities, have delayed this week's scheduled return to classrooms following the holiday break or switched to remote learning as the Omicron variant of the coronavirus drives record levels of COVID-19.", "Health authorities gave approval for a booster shot for kids aged 12 to 15.", "Starbucks will require its US workers to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or undergo weekly testing in order to comply with new federal mandates, the company said in an update sent to employees on Monday.", "Israel", "Israel said it will admit foreigners with presumed COVID-19 immunity from countries deemed medium-risk, partially reversing a ban on entry by foreigners imposed in late November.\u00a0", "Botswana", "Botswana's President Mokgweetsi Masisi is in mandatory self-isolation after testing positive for COVID-19 in routine testing.\u00a0", "Reuters / Newshub."]
